result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory S Ostern was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$200 DNA surcharge remitted.
11/4/14: Crt orders JOC be amended to reflect that the court costs are to be converted to an additional 14 days jail (under 973.07) per def's request. All other conditions remain the same.
Concur to 01CF533 & 12CT209.  To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).

11/4/14: Crt orders JOC be amended to reflect that the court costs are to be converted to an additional 14 days jail (under 973.07) per def's request. All other conditions remain the same.  To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2). 1/16/15: Costs are waived and the amended JOC adding a 14 day jail sentence is hereby VACATED.
